abstract.text: A template for displaying a header row and two lines of text.

inlineContent.text: to create complications for watchOS 10 or later. For more information, see Migrating to WidgetKit.

platforms.message: On watchOS 9.0 or later, use WidgetKit instead
platforms.name: watchOS

inlineContent.text: The following table lists the dimensions of the image you use in this template. All dimensions are in pixels. All images must be specified as
images for display on Apple Watch, so the point-based dimensions are half the listed size. The width of the image must be between the specified minimum and maximum (inclusive).
Instead of providing multiple images with different resolutions, you can provide a single, scaleable PDF asset. For more information, see

abstract.text: Display app-specific data on the clock face.
A large rectangular area that ClockKit displays on the Modular watch face.
An abstract class that defines the base behavior for all templates.
A template for displaying a header row and two lines of text.
The top line of body text.
An optional second line of body text.
An optional image to display in the header.
The text to display in the header line.
Creates a new template that has a header row with an image and text, and a row of body text.
Creates a new template that has a header row with an image and text, and two rows of body text.
Creates a new template that has a row of header text and a row of body text.
Creates a new template that has a row of header text and two rows of body text.
Returns a new template that has a header row with an image and text, and a row of body text.
Returns a new template that has a header row with an image and text, and two rows of body text.
Returns a new template that has a row of header text and a row of body text.
Returns a new template that has a row of header text and two rows of body text.
A template for displaying a header row and row of tall body text.
Extend the reach of your app by creating widgets, watch complications, Live Activities, and controls.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.

media-2933747.alt: A diagram showing the layout of the modular large standard body complication. The diagram shows the header row, two lines of text, and an optional header image.

inlineContent.text: to create complications for watchOS 10 or later. For more information, see Migrating to WidgetKit.
